intro: Guatteria xylopioides, commonly known as the Mexican wax apple, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central America and the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. Due to its ornamental value and fruit, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
